description: APPLICATION FOR CHANGE OF USE FROM A TYRE RETAILING AND FITTING PLACE (USE CLASS A1) TO A TYRE RETAILING AND FITTING PLACE (USE CLASS A1) WITH AN ANCILLARY MOT TESTING STATION
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site location plan and drawing marked 'Proposed Plan'

Condition : 3 - The uses shall only operate between the hours of 8:30am and 7pm Monday to Saturday and not at all during Sundays or Bank Holidays without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - No panel beating or paint spraying shall take place on the premises unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason; to protect the amenity of neighbouring residents in accordance with Policies DM D2 and DM EP2 of the Adopted Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014

Condition : 5 - The applicant is advised that it is an Offence under the Highways Act 1980 to carry out or operate any part of the business (other than customer parking subject to any parking restrictions), on the public highway. This includes working on motor vehicles, storing or positioning tyres or other materials on the highway and the pavement and obstructing the highway and pavement. The pavement should retain clear passage for pedestrians to use without the need to use the carriageway. The applicant should note that Council Highways Officers have the power to prosecute offences under the Highways Act 1980.

Condition : 6 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with pre-application advice.
   ii) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   iii) The application was approved without delay.
   iv) The application was considered by the Planning Committee where the applicant/agent had the opportunity to speak to the committee and promote the application.
